rules.message: Special categories of data under GDPR Article 9 require explicit consent
rules.remediation: Implement explicit consent mechanism specifically for special category data

rules.message: Processing children's data requires parental consent in most EU member states
rules.remediation: Implement age verification and parental consent mechanisms

rules.message: Direct marketing typically requires consent under GDPR
rules.remediation: Implement clear opt-in mechanisms for marketing communications

rules.message: Consent must be freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous - pre-checked boxes and implied consent are invalid
rules.remediation: Replace with clear opt-in checkboxes or explicit affirmative actions

rules.message: Legitimate interests require documented balancing test considering individual rights
rules.remediation: Conduct and document legitimate interest assessment (LIA)

and.value: Providing products or services to customers

rules.message: Contract basis only valid if processing is necessary to perform the contract
rules.remediation: Verify processing is actually necessary for contract performance, or consider alternative lawful basis

rules.message: Behavioral tracking for marketing/analytics typically requires consent
rules.remediation: Implement cookie consent banners and clear opt-in for behavioral tracking

processingActivityAnalysis.description: System analyzes each processing activity against GDPR requirements
validationProcess: Check lawful basis validity for stated purpose
Validate consent mechanisms if consent is claimed

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you serve customers or clients in the European Union?
assessmentQuestions.help: This includes any goods or services offered to individuals in EU member states

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have an establishment (office, subsidiary, etc.) in the EU?
assessmentQuestions.help: An establishment means a fixed place of business through which the activities are wholly or partly carried out

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many EU residents' personal data do you process annually?
assessmentQuestions.help: Include customers, employees, vendors, website visitors, etc.

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you transfer personal data outside the European Economic Area?
assessmentQuestions.help: This includes cloud storage, third-party services, or subsidiaries outside the EEA

assessmentQuestions.question: To which countries/regions do you transfer personal data?
choices: We don't transfer data outside the EEA
assessmentQuestions.help: Include any transfers through cloud services, subsidiaries, or third-party providers

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you currently transfer data internationally?
choices: Cloud storage services (AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure)
Direct data sharing with overseas subsidiaries
assessmentQuestions.help: Include all methods, even if through third-party services

assessmentQuestions.question: What protections do you currently have for international transfers?
choices: Contracts with cloud providers mentioning data protection
Don't know what protections we have
assessmentQuestions.help: This helps assess current compliance with GDPR transfer requirements

assessmentQuestions.loop_question: Do you have another processing activity to document?
assessmentQuestions.initial_question: Let's document each way you process personal data. This helps ensure proper lawful basis for each activity.

iteration_questions.question: What would you call this processing activity?
What is the primary purpose of this processing?
choices: Providing products or services to customers

iteration_questions.question: What categories of personal data do you process for this purpose?
choices: Basic contact information (name, email, phone, address)
Financial information (payment details, billing, credit info)
Technical information (IP address, device info, cookies)
Professional information (job title, company, work history)
Special category data (race, religion, political views)

iteration_questions.question: Who are the data subjects for this processing?
What lawful basis do you rely on for this processing?
choices: Contract - necessary to perform our contract with them
Legal obligation - required by law or regulation
Vital interests - protecting someone's life or health
Public task - carrying out official functions
Legitimate interests - our legitimate business needs
iteration_questions.help: The system will validate this choice against GDPR requirements for your specific data and purpose

iteration_questions.question: How do you obtain consent for this processing?
choices: Clear affirmative action (button click, form submission)

iteration_questions.question: Describe your legitimate interest and balancing test
iteration_questions.help: You must demonstrate: (1) legitimate interest, (2) necessity for that interest, and (3) that your interests don't override individual rights

iteration_questions.question: What law or regulation requires this processing?
iteration_questions.help: Specify the exact legal requirement (e.g., 'Tax records retention under [specific law]')

iteration_questions.question: How long do you retain this data?
choices: Only as long as necessary for the purpose
We don't have a defined retention period

iteration_questions.question: Do you share this data with third parties?
choices: We don't share this data with third parties

iteration_questions.question: Is this data transferred outside the EEA?
choices: Yes, to countries with adequacy decisions
Yes, but no safeguards in place

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you currently obtain consent from individuals?
choices: Implied through continued use of service
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires consent to be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous

assessmentQuestions.question: How specific is your consent collection?
choices: Separate consent for each processing purpose
General consent for all processing activities
We use one blanket consent form
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires consent to be specific to particular processing purposes

assessmentQuestions.question: How can individuals withdraw consent?
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires withdrawal to be as easy as giving consent

assessmentQuestions.question: Which special categories of personal data do you process?
choices: Health data (medical records, fitness data, mental health information)
Biometric data for identification (fingerprints, facial recognition, voice recognition)
Genetic data (DNA analysis, genetic testing results)
Data concerning sex life or sexual orientation
assessmentQuestions.help: Select all categories that apply. Special categories require explicit consent or other specific legal basis under GDPR Article 9

assessmentQuestions.question: How long do you typically retain different types of personal data?
choices: We have specific retention periods for different data types
We keep data indefinitely unless requested to delete
We delete data after a standard period (e.g., 7 years)
We don't have defined retention periods
We only delete data when legally required
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires data to be kept no longer than necessary for the purposes

assessmentQuestions.question: What triggers data deletion in your current processes?
assessmentQuestions.help: Understanding current deletion practices helps assess GDPR compliance

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you log access to personal data?
choices: Comprehensive logging of all data access
assessmentQuestions.help: Access logging is important for breach detection and accountability

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have designated contacts for breach notifications?
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires notification to supervisory authority within 72 hours

assessmentQuestions.question: Have you identified which data protection authority you would notify in case of a breach?
assessmentQuestions.help: Each EU member state has its own data protection authority

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many individual rights requests do you receive monthly?
assessmentQuestions.help: This helps assess the scale of your rights management needs

assessmentQuestions.question: How long does it typically take to respond to individual rights requests?
choices: We haven't processed any requests yet
assessmentQuestions.help: GDPR requires responses within 1 month, extendable to 3 months in complex cases

assessmentQuestions.question: Is your organization a public authority or public body?
assessmentQuestions.help: This includes government agencies, municipal authorities, regulatory bodies, and similar public sector organizations

assessmentQuestions.question: Do your core business activities involve regular and systematic monitoring of data subjects?
assessmentQuestions.help: Examples: behavioral advertising, location tracking, telecommunications monitoring, credit monitoring, employee surveillance systems

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you process special categories of personal data on a large scale?
assessmentQuestions.help: Special categories include health data, biometric data, racial/ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, trade union membership, genetic data, or data concerning sex life/sexual orientation

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you use automated decision-making or profiling that produces legal effects or significantly affects individuals?
assessmentQuestions.help: Examples: automated loan approvals, algorithmic hiring decisions, credit scoring, automated insurance claims processing, targeted advertising based on profiling

assessmentQuestions.question: If you conduct systematic monitoring, approximately how many individuals are monitored?
assessmentQuestions.help: Include website tracking, location monitoring, surveillance systems, behavioral analysis, etc.

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you process personal data of vulnerable data subjects on a large scale?
assessmentQuestions.help: Vulnerable subjects include children, elderly, patients, employees, individuals in financial distress, or those lacking capacity to consent

categories.name: Lawful Basis for Processing
categories.description: Requirements for establishing valid legal grounds for processing personal data

categories.name: Transparency Requirements
categories.description: Obligations to provide clear information to data subjects about processing

categories.name: Individual Rights
categories.description: Rights that must be provided to data subjects under GDPR

categories.name: Data Protection Requirements
categories.description: Technical and organizational measures for protecting personal data

categories.name: Accountability Requirements
categories.description: Obligations to demonstrate compliance with GDPR principles

categories.name: International Data Transfers
categories.description: Requirements for transferring personal data outside the EEA

requirements.title: Processing requires lawful basis
requirements.description: Processing of personal data is lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the lawful bases applies
requirements.details: Processing of personal data is lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the lawful bases applies: consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public interest, or legitimate interests.

complianceChecks.description: Document lawful basis for each processing activity
Identify and document lawful basis before processing begins

requirements.title: Conditions for consent
requirements.description: Consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes
requirements.details: Consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes, by a clear affirmative action.

complianceChecks.description: Implement consent management system that records when, how, and what was consented to
Ensure consent withdrawal is as easy as giving consent

requirements.title: Privacy notice must be provided to data subjects
requirements.description: Controllers must provide information to data subjects at the time personal data is obtained
requirements.details: Controllers must provide information to data subjects at the time personal data is obtained, including identity and contact details of the controller, purposes of processing, legal basis, recipients, retention period, and data subject rights.

complianceChecks.description: Create comprehensive privacy notice covering all required elements
Provide privacy notice at point of data collection

requirements.title: Privacy notice must be concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible
requirements.description: Information must be provided in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form
requirements.details: Information must be provided in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

complianceChecks.description: Review privacy notice for plain language and accessibility

requirements.title: Right of access by the data subject
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether personal data concerning them is being processed
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether personal data concerning them is being processed, and if so, access to the personal data and specific information about the processing.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process for handling subject access requests within 1 month
Maintain systems capable of locating and extracting individual's data

requirements.title: Right to rectification
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to obtain without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning them.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process for correcting inaccurate data within 1 month

requirements.title: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain the erasure of personal data concerning them without undue delay
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to obtain the erasure of personal data concerning them without undue delay under certain circumstances.

complianceChecks.description: Implement deletion process considering legal grounds and exceptions
Ensure technical capability to delete data across all systems

requirements.title: Right to restriction of processing
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain restriction of processing under certain circumstances
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to obtain restriction of processing under certain circumstances.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process to restrict processing when required
Technical capability to flag and restrict processing of specific data

requirements.title: Right to data portability
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to receive personal data in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to receive the personal data concerning them in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance.

complianceChecks.description: Implement data export functionality in machine-readable format

requirements.title: Right to object
requirements.description: Data subjects have the right to object to processing of personal data
requirements.details: Data subjects have the right to object to processing of personal data based on legitimate interests, public interest, or official authority, and for direct marketing purposes.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process to handle objections, especially for direct marketing

requirements.title: Data protection by design and by default
requirements.description: Controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures
requirements.details: Controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to implement data protection principles and to integrate necessary safeguards into the processing.

complianceChecks.description: Implement privacy by design in system development
Establish data protection by design policies

requirements.title: Security of processing
requirements.description: Controller and processor shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures
requirements.details: Controller and processor shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk.

complianceChecks.description: Implement encryption, access controls, and other security measures
Document security measures and conduct regular reviews

requirements.title: Data breach notification to supervisory authority
requirements.description: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall notify the supervisory authority
requirements.details: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority.

complianceChecks.description: Implement breach detection and 72-hour notification process
Maintain breach register and notification procedures

requirements.title: Data breach notification to data subject
requirements.description: When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk, notify the data subject
requirements.details: When the personal data breach is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall communicate the personal data breach to the data subject without undue delay.

complianceChecks.description: Implement high-risk breach notification to individuals

requirements.title: Records of processing activities
requirements.description: Each controller shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility
requirements.details: Each controller and, where applicable, the controller's representative, shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility.

complianceChecks.description: Maintain comprehensive record of processing activities (ROPA)

requirements.title: Data Protection Impact Assessment
requirements.description: Where processing is likely to result in a high risk, carry out an impact assessment
requirements.details: Where processing is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall carry out an assessment of the impact of the envisaged processing operations on the protection of personal data.

complianceChecks.description: Maintain records of legitimate interest assessments and balancing tests
Conduct DPIA for high-risk processing activities

requirements.title: Data Protection Officer
requirements.description: The controller and processor shall designate a data protection officer in certain cases
requirements.details: The controller and the processor shall designate a data protection officer in certain cases specified by the regulation.

complianceChecks.description: Appoint qualified Data Protection Officer
Document DPO appointment and publish contact details

requirements.title: Transfers on the basis of an adequacy decision
requirements.description: A transfer may take place where the Commission has decided the third country ensures adequate protection
requirements.details: A transfer of personal data to a third country or an international organisation may take place where the Commission has decided that the third country, a territory or one or more specified sectors within that third country, or the international organisation in question ensures an adequate level of protection.

complianceChecks.description: Verify adequacy status of transfer destinations

requirements.title: Transfers subject to appropriate safeguards
requirements.description: In the absence of an adequacy decision, transfers require appropriate safeguards
requirements.details: In the absence of an adequacy decision, a controller or processor may transfer personal data to a third country or an international organisation only if the controller or processor has provided appropriate safeguards, and on condition that enforceable data subject rights and effective legal remedies for data subjects are available.

complianceChecks.description: Implement Standard Contractual Clauses or other appropriate safeguards
Conduct Transfer Impact Assessments where required
